refnamediv.refpurpose: Server for image processing. Order images into queue, runs processing script on one after another to do basic image processing.

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: &dhpackage; is a RTS2 component for running image processing script. Image processing script is a standalone binary/script, which communicate with &dhpackage; through standard input/output.

refsect1.title: Image processing stdin/stdout protocol
refsect1.para: You can use in image processing most of the commands mentioned in rts2.script5. Plus you can use the additional, image processing script specific commands:

listitem.para: Command correction with error. Similar to correct, but allows users to specify position error. The error is angular distance (in degrees) between recorded telescope position and calculated position.

refsect1.title: Commands
refsect1.para: The following commands can be issued over TCP/IP connection.

refsect2.title: que_image
refsect2.para: Queue image for processing. Standard image processing script is then called on given image.

refsect2.title: only_process
refsect2.para: Queue image for processing. Image will not be opened and its data won't be written into database. This command is handy to process images which does not has RTS2 keywords in FITS header.
Command can be followed by an arbitary number of arguments, which will be passed to processing script as command line arguments.

refsect1.title: Variables
refsect1.para: &dhpackage; exposes to system by default the following variables.
refsect1.variablelist:
&infotime;
apply_corrections
If true, corrections from astrometry are applied. You can use this to quickly disable corrections if they just make observation worse.
good_astrom
Total number of images with astrometry from last system restart.
no_astrom
Total number of images without astrometry from last system restart.
failed_images
Total number of images which processing script failed (e.g. returned non-0 return status) from last system restart.
dark_images
Total number of dark images.
flat_images
Total number of flat images processed through system.
queue_size
Size of the images queue. If a new image is queued to image processor while another image is beeing processed, new image is put into queue.
